Anyhoo, to those thinking you need a serial, you are wrong. After you get over the hump of having the game running you'll wonder:

How do I save the game
1. Start the game.
2. In the menu, press a key Home.
3. On top is lowered window, Press "Create a new profile.
4. Now we choose, to create autonomous profile.
5. Enter any name in English. and click Send.
6. Now click Finish. You can pre-configure your profile if you wish.

This is correct, but when you click create new profile, you need to scroll down and then there is a link within the paragraph referencing a local profile. Click that, you're golden. Jesus- it took me literally 1.5 hours to figure it out.

I think u did some mistake.It's working for me.Install the game in default directory.

Try these steps:- 
- Go to regedit, if you don't know how to open that, please consult Google.
- Go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE
- Software
- Rockstar Games (create this if it doesn't exist, using right mouse button, new, key)
- EFLC (create this if not available, see above)
- In EFLC, right click on the big white screen, New, string value
- Name it "InstallFolder"
- Find the path where you downloaded everything, the main folder i.e. C:Program FilesRockstar GamesGrand Theft Auto IV Episodes From Liberty CityEFLC, which contains files like data.dll, EFLC.exe, etc.., and copy the location.
- Edit the InstallFolder-string value, and paste the data to the location you just copied
- You're done :)

Start the game with LaunchEFLC.exe

You must have both LaunchEFLC.exe and LaunchEFLCc.exe in the EFLC folder.Try launching the game through both the files one by one.See whether any of them sort your problem or not.If not please do reply so that we could provide you some other solution. 
Hope it helps!

The crack that comes with this upload will not work.Please download this crack torrent and follow the instructions given in that.:- http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5497507/GTA_IV__Episodes_From_Liberty_City_Crack___.Reg

I checked it by myself.The above crack worked well for me.
Note:-Install the game in default directory.

Those who are getting "SecuROM
Launcher has stopped working" error can solve this error by following below steps:-
1.Clean install both the DVD that comes with this.

2.Download this crack and extract it:- http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5497507/GTA_IV__Episodes_From_Liberty_City_Crack___.Reg
You'll get EFLC-mbb folder and there were 6 files in the folder.Copy all the files except 'EFLC install' and 'Readme' file and paste it to C:/Program files/Rockstar Games/EFLC

3. Now do this important step:-
- Go to regedit, if you don't know how to open that, please consult Google.
- Go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE
- Software
- Rockstar Games
- EFLC 
- In EFLC, right click on the big white screen, New, string value
- Name it "InstallFolder"
- Find the path where you downloaded everything, the main folder i.e. C/Program Files/Rockstar Games/EFLC, which contains files like data.dll, EFLC.exe, etc.., and copy the location.
- Right click on InstallFolder-string value and click modify, and paste the data to the location you just copied.

4. Open DVD 1 and you'll see a folder named crack.Just goto the update folder inside the crack folder and run setup.

Done!!!
Enjoy

Thanks to jadawgkss for describing how to create a profile to be able to save your games. The following code is COPIED from jadawgkss (the first comment page):

How do I save the game
1. Start the game.
2. In the menu, press a key Home.
3. On top is lowered window, Press "Create a new profile.
4. Now we choose, to create autonomous profile.
5. Enter any name in English. and click Send.
6. Now click Finish. You can pre-configure your profile if you wish.

Took nearly a full day to download (SEED DAMN IT) but installation was easy. 

Follow the steps and mount disc 2 when asked to, then mount disc 1 when asked to. 

Once finished update the game by mounting Disc 1 and going into the crack>update folder. You should update to 1.1.2.0 also to stop loading loops. To save just make an offline GFWL profile.

Note: I didn't activate the game via Rockstar's validation thing but my game reads that it's updated to 1.1.2.0. I just finished Chinese Takeout with no issues and running ENBv0.9.
